column1: Figure 2: Income inequality for people in retired households increased by 3.9 percentage points in the 10-year period leading up to financial year ending (FYE) 2022
Gini coefficients for disposable income by household type, UK, 1977 to financial year ending 2022

column2:
1. 2021/22 represents the financial year ending 2022, (April to March), and similarly for all other years expressed in this format. Estimates prior to FYE 1995 are measured on a calendar year basis.
2. Estimates of income inequality from FYE 2002 onwards have been adjusted for the under-coverage of top earners. 
3. Estimates up to and including financial year ending (FYE) 2017 are sourced from the Living Costs and Food Survey (LCF). Estimates from FYE 2018 onwards are based on the Household Finances Survey, which the LCF is part of.
